lines.value: TROILUS
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Call here my varlet; I'll unarm again:
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Why should I war without the walls of Troy,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: That find such cruel battle here within?
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Each Trojan that is master of his heart,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Let him to field; Troilus, alas! hath none.
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: PANDARUS
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: Will this gear ne'er be mended?
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: TROILUS
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: The Greeks are strong and skilful to their strength,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Fierce to their skill and to their fierceness valiant;
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: But I am weaker than a woman's tear,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Tamer than sleep, fonder than ignorance,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Less valiant than the virgin in the night
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: And skilless as unpractised infancy.
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: PANDARUS
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: Well, I have told you enough of this: for my part,
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: I'll not meddle nor make no further. He that will
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: have a cake out of the wheat must needs tarry the grinding.
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: TROILUS
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Have I not tarried?
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: PANDARUS
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: Ay, the grinding; but you must tarry
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: the bolting.
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: TROILUS
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Have I not tarried?
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: PANDARUS
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: Ay, the bolting, but you must tarry the leavening.
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: TROILUS
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Still have I tarried.
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: PANDARUS
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: Ay, to the leavening; but here's yet in the word
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: 'hereafter' the kneading, the making of the cake, the
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: heating of the oven and the baking; nay, you must
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: stay the cooling too, or you may chance to burn your lips.
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: TROILUS
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Patience herself, what goddess e'er she be,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Doth lesser blench at sufferance than I do.
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: At Priam's royal table do I sit;
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: And when fair Cressid comes into my thoughts,--
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: So, traitor! 'When she comes!' When is she thence?
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: PANDARUS
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: Well, she looked yesternight fairer than ever I saw
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: her look, or any woman else.
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: TROILUS
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: I was about to tell thee:--when my heart,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: As wedged with a sigh, would rive in twain,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Lest Hector or my father should perceive me,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: I have, as when the sun doth light a storm,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Buried this sigh in wrinkle of a smile:
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: But sorrow, that is couch'd in seeming gladness,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Is like that mirth fate turns to sudden sadness.
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: PANDARUS
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: An her hair were not somewhat darker than Helen's--
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: well, go to--there were no more comparison between
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: the women: but, for my part, she is my kinswoman; I
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: would not, as they term it, praise her: but I would
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: somebody had heard her talk yesterday, as I did. I
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: will not dispraise your sister Cassandra's wit, but--
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: TROILUS
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: O Pandarus! I tell thee, Pandarus,--
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: When I do tell thee, there my hopes lie drown'd,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Reply not in how many fathoms deep
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: They lie indrench'd. I tell thee I am mad
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: In Cressid's love: thou answer'st 'she is fair;'
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Pour'st in the open ulcer of my heart
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Her eyes, her hair, her cheek, her gait, her voice,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Handlest in thy discourse, O, that her hand,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: In whose comparison all whites are ink,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Writing their own reproach, to whose soft seizure
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: The cygnet's down is harsh and spirit of sense
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Hard as the palm of ploughman: this thou tell'st me,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: As true thou tell'st me, when I say I love her;
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: But, saying thus, instead of oil and balm,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Thou lay'st in every gash that love hath given me
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: The knife that made it.
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: PANDARUS
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: I speak no more than truth.
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: TROILUS
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Thou dost not speak so much.
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: PANDARUS
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: Faith, I'll not meddle in't. Let her be as she is:
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: if she be fair, 'tis the better for her; an she be
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: not, she has the mends in her own hands.
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: TROILUS
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Good Pandarus, how now, Pandarus!
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: PANDARUS
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: I have had my labour for my travail; ill-thought on of
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: her and ill-thought on of you; gone between and
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: between, but small thanks for my labour.
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: TROILUS
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: What, art thou angry, Pandarus? what, with me?
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: PANDARUS
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: Because she's kin to me, therefore she's not so fair
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: as Helen: an she were not kin to me, she would be as
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: fair on Friday as Helen is on Sunday. But what care
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: I? I care not an she were a black-a-moor; 'tis all one to me.
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: TROILUS
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Say I she is not fair?
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: PANDARUS
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: I do not care whether you do or no. She's a fool to
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: stay behind her father; let her to the Greeks; and so
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: I'll tell her the next time I see her: for my part,
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: I'll meddle nor make no more i' the matter.
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: TROILUS
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Pandarus,--
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: PANDARUS
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: Not I.
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: TROILUS
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Sweet Pandarus,--
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: PANDARUS
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: Pray you, speak no more to me: I will leave all as I
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: found it, and there an end.
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: TROILUS
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Peace, you ungracious clamours! peace, rude sounds!
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Fools on both sides! Helen must needs be fair,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: When with your blood you daily paint her thus.
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: I cannot fight upon this argument;
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: It is too starved a subject for my sword.
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: But Pandarus,--O gods, how do you plague me!
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: I cannot come to Cressid but by Pandar;
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: And he's as tetchy to be woo'd to woo.
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: As she is stubborn-chaste against all suit.
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Tell me, Apollo, for thy Daphne's love,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: What Cressid is, what Pandar, and what we?
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Her bed is India; there she lies, a pearl:
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Between our Ilium and where she resides,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Let it be call'd the wild and wandering flood,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Ourself the merchant, and this sailing Pandar
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Our doubtful hope, our convoy and our bark.
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: AENEAS
lines.speaker: AENEAS

lines.value: How now, Prince Troilus! wherefore not afield?
lines.speaker: AENEAS

lines.value: TROILUS
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Because not there: this woman's answer sorts,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: For womanish it is to be from thence.
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: What news, AEneas, from the field to-day?
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: AENEAS
lines.speaker: AENEAS

lines.value: That Paris is returned home and hurt.
lines.speaker: AENEAS

lines.value: TROILUS
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: By whom, AEneas?
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: AENEAS
lines.speaker: AENEAS

lines.value: Troilus, by Menelaus.
lines.speaker: AENEAS

lines.value: TROILUS
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Let Paris bleed; 'tis but a scar to scorn;
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Paris is gored with Menelaus' horn.
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: AENEAS
lines.speaker: AENEAS

lines.value: Hark, what good sport is out of town to-day!
lines.speaker: AENEAS

lines.value: TROILUS
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Better at home, if 'would I might' were 'may.'
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: But to the sport abroad: are you bound thither?
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: AENEAS
lines.speaker: AENEAS

lines.value: In all swift haste.
lines.speaker: AENEAS

lines.value: TROILUS
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Come, go we then together.
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: CRESSIDA
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: Who were those went by?

lines.value: ALEXANDER
lines.speaker: ALEXANDER

lines.value: Queen Hecuba and Helen.
lines.speaker: ALEXANDER

lines.value: CRESSIDA
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: And whither go they?
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: ALEXANDER
lines.speaker: ALEXANDER

lines.value: Up to the eastern tower,
lines.speaker: ALEXANDER

lines.value: Whose height commands as subject all the vale,
lines.speaker: ALEXANDER

lines.value: To see the battle. Hector, whose patience
lines.speaker: ALEXANDER

lines.value: Is, as a virtue, fix'd, to-day was moved:
lines.speaker: ALEXANDER

lines.value: He chid Andromache and struck his armourer,
lines.speaker: ALEXANDER

lines.value: And, like as there were husbandry in war,
lines.speaker: ALEXANDER

lines.value: Before the sun rose he was harness'd light,
lines.speaker: ALEXANDER

lines.value: And to the field goes he; where every flower
lines.speaker: ALEXANDER

lines.value: Did, as a prophet, weep what it foresaw
lines.speaker: ALEXANDER

lines.value: In Hector's wrath.
lines.speaker: ALEXANDER

lines.value: CRESSIDA
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: What was his cause of anger?
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: ALEXANDER
lines.speaker: ALEXANDER

lines.value: The noise goes, this: there is among the Greeks
lines.speaker: ALEXANDER

lines.value: A lord of Trojan blood, nephew to Hector;
lines.speaker: ALEXANDER

lines.value: They call him Ajax.
lines.speaker: ALEXANDER

lines.value: CRESSIDA
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: Good; and what of him?
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: ALEXANDER
lines.speaker: ALEXANDER

lines.value: They say he is a very man per se,
lines.speaker: ALEXANDER

lines.value: And stands alone.
lines.speaker: ALEXANDER

lines.value: CRESSIDA
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: So do all men, unless they are drunk, sick, or have no legs.
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: ALEXANDER
lines.speaker: ALEXANDER

lines.value: This man, lady, hath robbed many beasts of their
lines.speaker: ALEXANDER

lines.value: particular additions; he is as valiant as the lion,
lines.speaker: ALEXANDER

lines.value: churlish as the bear, slow as the elephant: a man
lines.speaker: ALEXANDER

lines.value: into whom nature hath so crowded humours that his
lines.speaker: ALEXANDER

lines.value: valour is crushed into folly, his folly sauced with
lines.speaker: ALEXANDER

lines.value: discretion: there is no man hath a virtue that he
lines.speaker: ALEXANDER

lines.value: hath not a glimpse of, nor any man an attaint but he
lines.speaker: ALEXANDER

lines.value: carries some stain of it: he is melancholy without
lines.speaker: ALEXANDER

lines.value: cause, and merry against the hair: he hath the
lines.speaker: ALEXANDER

lines.value: joints of every thing, but everything so out of joint
lines.speaker: ALEXANDER

lines.value: that he is a gouty Briareus, many hands and no use,
lines.speaker: ALEXANDER

lines.value: or purblind Argus, all eyes and no sight.
lines.speaker: ALEXANDER

lines.value: CRESSIDA
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: But how should this man, that makes
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: me smile, make Hector angry?
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: ALEXANDER
lines.speaker: ALEXANDER

lines.value: They say he yesterday coped Hector in the battle and
lines.speaker: ALEXANDER

lines.value: struck him down, the disdain and shame whereof hath
lines.speaker: ALEXANDER

lines.value: ever since kept Hector fasting and waking.
lines.speaker: ALEXANDER

lines.value: CRESSIDA
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: Who comes here?
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: ALEXANDER
lines.speaker: ALEXANDER

lines.value: Madam, your uncle Pandarus.
lines.speaker: ALEXANDER

lines.value: CRESSIDA
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: Hector's a gallant man.
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: ALEXANDER
lines.speaker: ALEXANDER

lines.value: As may be in the world, lady.
lines.speaker: ALEXANDER

lines.value: PANDARUS
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: What's that? what's that?

lines.value: CRESSIDA
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: Good morrow, uncle Pandarus.
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: PANDARUS
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: Good morrow, cousin Cressid: what do you talk of?
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: Good morrow, Alexander. How do you, cousin? When

lines.value: were you at Ilium?
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: CRESSIDA
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: This morning, uncle.
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: PANDARUS
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: What were you talking of when I came? Was Hector
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: armed and gone ere ye came to Ilium? Helen was not
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: up, was she?
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: CRESSIDA
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: Hector was gone, but Helen was not up.
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: PANDARUS
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: Even so: Hector was stirring early.
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: CRESSIDA
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: That were we talking of, and of his anger.
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: PANDARUS
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: Was he angry?
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: CRESSIDA
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: So he says here.
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: PANDARUS
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: True, he was so: I know the cause too: he'll lay
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: about him to-day, I can tell them that: and there's
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: Troilus will not come far behind him: let them take
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: heed of Troilus, I can tell them that too.
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: CRESSIDA
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: What, is he angry too?
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: PANDARUS
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: Who, Troilus? Troilus is the better man of the two.
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: CRESSIDA
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: O Jupiter! there's no comparison.
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: PANDARUS
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: What, not between Troilus and Hector? Do you know a

lines.value: man if you see him?
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: CRESSIDA
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: Ay, if I ever saw him before and knew him.
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: PANDARUS
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: Well, I say Troilus is Troilus.
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: CRESSIDA
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: Then you say as I say; for, I am sure, he is not Hector.
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: PANDARUS
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: No, nor Hector is not Troilus in some degrees.
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: CRESSIDA
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: 'Tis just to each of them; he is himself.
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: PANDARUS
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: Himself! Alas, poor Troilus! I would he were.
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: CRESSIDA
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: So he is.
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: PANDARUS
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: Condition, I had gone barefoot to India.

lines.value: CRESSIDA
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: He is not Hector.
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: PANDARUS
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: Himself! no, he's not himself: would a' were

lines.value: CRESSIDA
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: Excuse me.

lines.value: PANDARUS
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: He is elder.

lines.value: CRESSIDA
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: PANDARUS
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: tale, when th' other's come to't. Hector shall not

lines.value: CRESSIDA
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: He shall not need it, if he have his own.

lines.value: PANDARUS
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: PANDARUS
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: Nor his beauty.

lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: herself swore th' other day, that Troilus, for

lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: not brown neither,--

lines.value: CRESSIDA
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: No, but brown.

lines.value: PANDARUS
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: 'Faith, to say truth, brown and not brown.

lines.value: CRESSIDA
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: PANDARUS
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: CRESSIDA

lines.value: PANDARUS

lines.value: He offers in another's enterprise;
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: Than in the glass of Pandar's praise may be;
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: Yet hold I off. Women are angels, wooing:
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: Things won are done; joy's soul lies in the doing.
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: That she beloved knows nought that knows not this:
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: Men prize the thing ungain'd more than it is:
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: That she was never yet that ever knew
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: Love got so sweet as when desire did sue.
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: Therefore this maxim out of love I teach:
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: Achievement is command; ungain'd, beseech:
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: Then though my heart's content firm love doth bear,
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: Nothing of that shall from mine eyes appear.

lines.value: AGAMEMNON
lines.speaker: AGAMEMNON

lines.value: Princes,
lines.speaker: AGAMEMNON

lines.value: What grief hath set the jaundice on your cheeks?
lines.speaker: AGAMEMNON

lines.value: The ample proposition that hope makes
lines.speaker: AGAMEMNON

lines.value: In all designs begun on earth below
lines.speaker: AGAMEMNON

lines.value: Fails in the promised largeness: cheques and disasters
lines.speaker: AGAMEMNON

lines.value: Grow in the veins of actions highest rear'd,
lines.speaker: AGAMEMNON

lines.value: As knots, by the conflux of meeting sap,
lines.speaker: AGAMEMNON

lines.value: Infect the sound pine and divert his grain
lines.speaker: AGAMEMNON

lines.value: Tortive and errant from his course of growth.
lines.speaker: AGAMEMNON

lines.value: Nor, princes, is it matter new to us
lines.speaker: AGAMEMNON

lines.value: That we come short of our suppose so far
lines.speaker: AGAMEMNON

lines.value: That after seven years' siege yet Troy walls stand;
lines.speaker: AGAMEMNON

lines.value: Sith every action that hath gone before,
lines.speaker: AGAMEMNON

lines.value: Whereof we have record, trial did draw
lines.speaker: AGAMEMNON

lines.value: Bias and thwart, not answering the aim,
lines.speaker: AGAMEMNON

lines.value: And that unbodied figure of the thought
lines.speaker: AGAMEMNON

lines.value: That gave't surmised shape. Why then, you princes,
lines.speaker: AGAMEMNON

lines.value: Do you with cheeks abash'd behold our works,
lines.speaker: AGAMEMNON

lines.value: And call them shames? which are indeed nought else
lines.speaker: AGAMEMNON

lines.value: But the protractive trials of great Jove
lines.speaker: AGAMEMNON

lines.value: To find persistive constancy in men:
lines.speaker: AGAMEMNON

lines.value: The fineness of which metal is not found
lines.speaker: AGAMEMNON

lines.value: In fortune's love; for then the bold and coward,
lines.speaker: AGAMEMNON

lines.value: The wise and fool, the artist and unread,
lines.speaker: AGAMEMNON

lines.value: The hard and soft seem all affined and kin:
lines.speaker: AGAMEMNON

lines.value: But, in the wind and tempest of her frown,
lines.speaker: AGAMEMNON

lines.value: Distinction, with a broad and powerful fan,
lines.speaker: AGAMEMNON

lines.value: Puffing at all, winnows the light away;
lines.speaker: AGAMEMNON

lines.value: And what hath mass or matter, by itself
lines.speaker: AGAMEMNON

lines.value: Lies rich in virtue and unmingled.
lines.speaker: AGAMEMNON

lines.value: NESTOR
lines.speaker: NESTOR

lines.value: With due observance of thy godlike seat,
lines.speaker: NESTOR

lines.value: Great Agamemnon, Nestor shall apply
lines.speaker: NESTOR

lines.value: Thy latest words. In the reproof of chance
lines.speaker: NESTOR

lines.value: Lies the true proof of men: the sea being smooth,
lines.speaker: NESTOR

lines.value: How many shallow bauble boats dare sail
lines.speaker: NESTOR

lines.value: Upon her patient breast, making their way
lines.speaker: NESTOR

lines.value: With those of nobler bulk!
lines.speaker: NESTOR

lines.value: But let the ruffian Boreas once enrage
lines.speaker: NESTOR

lines.value: The gentle Thetis, and anon behold
lines.speaker: NESTOR

lines.value: The strong-ribb'd bark through liquid mountains cut,
lines.speaker: NESTOR

lines.value: Bounding between the two moist elements,
lines.speaker: NESTOR

lines.value: Like Perseus' horse: where's then the saucy boat
lines.speaker: NESTOR

lines.value: Whose weak untimber'd sides but even now
lines.speaker: NESTOR

lines.value: Co-rivall'd greatness? Either to harbour fled,
lines.speaker: NESTOR

lines.value: Or made a toast for Neptune. Even so
lines.speaker: NESTOR

lines.value: Doth valour's show and valour's worth divide
lines.speaker: NESTOR

lines.value: In storms of fortune; for in her ray and brightness
lines.speaker: NESTOR

lines.value: The herd hath more annoyance by the breeze
lines.speaker: NESTOR

lines.value: Than by the tiger; but when the splitting wind
lines.speaker: NESTOR

lines.value: Makes flexible the knees of knotted oaks,
lines.speaker: NESTOR

lines.value: And flies fled under shade, why, then the thing of courage
lines.speaker: NESTOR

lines.value: As roused with rage with rage doth sympathize,
lines.speaker: NESTOR

lines.value: And with an accent tuned in selfsame key
lines.speaker: NESTOR

lines.value: Retorts to chiding fortune.
lines.speaker: NESTOR

lines.value: Should be shut up, hear what Ulysses speaks.

lines.value: Besides the applause and approbation To which,

lines.value: NESTOR

lines.value: If not Achilles? Though't be a sportful combat,
lines.speaker: NESTOR

lines.speaker: NESTOR

lines.value: For here the Trojans taste our dear'st repute
lines.speaker: NESTOR

lines.value: With their finest palate: and trust to me, Ulysses,
lines.speaker: NESTOR

lines.value: Our imputation shall be oddly poised
lines.speaker: NESTOR

lines.value: In this wild action; for the success,
lines.speaker: NESTOR

lines.value: Although particular, shall give a scantling
lines.speaker: NESTOR

lines.value: Of good or bad unto the general;
lines.speaker: NESTOR

lines.value: And in such indexes, although small pricks
lines.speaker: NESTOR

lines.value: To their subsequent volumes, there is seen

lines.value: The baby figure of the giant mass
lines.speaker: NESTOR

lines.value: Of things to come at large. It is supposed
lines.speaker: NESTOR

lines.speaker: NESTOR

lines.value: And choice, being mutual act of all our souls,
lines.speaker: NESTOR

lines.value: Makes merit her election, and doth boil,
lines.speaker: NESTOR

lines.value: As 'twere from us all, a man distill'd
lines.speaker: NESTOR

lines.value: Out of our virtues; who miscarrying,
lines.speaker: NESTOR

lines.value: What heart receives from hence the conquering part,
lines.speaker: NESTOR

lines.value: To steel a strong opinion to themselves?
lines.speaker: NESTOR

lines.value: Which entertain'd, limbs are his instruments,
lines.speaker: NESTOR

lines.value: In no less working than are swords and bows
lines.speaker: NESTOR

lines.value: Directive by the limbs.
lines.speaker: NESTOR

lines.value: ULYSSES
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: Give pardon to my speech:

lines.value: Therefore 'tis meet Achilles meet not Hector.

lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: ULYSSES

lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: But he already is too insolent;
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: Than in the pride and salt scorn of his eyes,
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: Should he 'scape Hector fair: if he were foil'd,
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: Our project's life this shape of sense assumes:

lines.value: We are too well acquainted with these answers:

lines.value: But his evasion, wing'd thus swift with scorn,
lines.speaker: AGAMEMNON

lines.speaker: PARIS

lines.value: PANDARUS
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: Love, love, nothing but love, still more!
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: For, O, love's bow
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: Shoots buck and doe:
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: The shaft confounds,
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: Not that it wounds,

lines.value: But tickles still the sore.
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: These lovers cry Oh! oh! they die!
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: Yet that which seems the wound to kill,

lines.value: Doth turn oh! oh! to ha! ha! he!
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: So dying love lives still:
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: Oh! oh! a while, but ha! ha! ha!
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: Oh! oh! groans out for ha! ha! ha!
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: Heigh-ho!
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: HELEN
lines.speaker: HELEN

lines.value: In love, i' faith, to the very tip of the nose.

lines.value: PANDARUS

lines.value: I am giddy; expectation whirls me round.
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: When that the watery palate tastes indeed

lines.value: Swooning destruction, or some joy too fine,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Too subtle-potent, tuned too sharp in sweetness,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: For the capacity of my ruder powers:
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: I fear it much; and I do fear besides,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: That I shall lose distinction in my joys;

lines.value: seas, live in fire, eat rocks, tame tigers; thinking
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: is infinite and the execution confined, that the

lines.value: Or else you love not, for to be wise and love
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: Exceeds man's might; that dwells with gods above.
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: TROILUS
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: O that I thought it could be in a woman--
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: As, if it can, I will presume in you--
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: To feed for aye her ramp and flames of love;
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: To keep her constancy in plight and youth,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Outliving beauty's outward, with a mind
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: That doth renew swifter than blood decays!
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Or that persuasion could but thus convince me,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: That my integrity and truth to you
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Might be affronted with the match and weight
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Of such a winnow'd purity in love;
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: How were I then uplifted! but, alas!
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: I am as true as truth's simplicity
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: And simpler than the infancy of truth.
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: CRESSIDA
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: In that I'll war with you.
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: TROILUS
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: O virtuous fight,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: When right with right wars who shall be most right!
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: True swains in love shall in the world to come
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Approve their truths by Troilus: when their rhymes,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Full of protest, of oath and big compare,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Want similes, truth tired with iteration,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: As true as steel, as plantage to the moon,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: As sun to day, as turtle to her mate,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: As iron to adamant, as earth to the centre,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Yet, after all comparisons of truth,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: As truth's authentic author to be cited,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: 'As true as Troilus' shall crown up the verse,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: And sanctify the numbers.
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: CRESSIDA
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: Prophet may you be!
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: If I be false, or swerve a hair from truth,
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: When time is old and hath forgot itself,
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: When waterdrops have worn the stones of Troy,
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: And blind oblivion swallow'd cities up,
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: And mighty states characterless are grated
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: To dusty nothing, yet let memory,
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: From false to false, among false maids in love,
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: Upbraid my falsehood! when they've said 'as false
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: As air, as water, wind, or sandy earth,
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: As fox to lamb, as wolf to heifer's calf,
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: Pard to the hind, or stepdame to her son,'
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: 'Yea,' let them say, to stick the heart of falsehood,
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: 'As false as Cressid.'
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: PANDARUS
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: Go to, a bargain made: seal it, seal it; I'll be the
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: witness. Here I hold your hand, here my cousin's.
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: If ever you prove false one to another, since I have
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: taken such pains to bring you together, let all
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: pitiful goers-between be called to the world's end
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: after my name; call them all Pandars; let all
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: constant men be Troiluses, all false women Cressids,
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: and all brokers-between Pandars! say, amen.
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: TROILUS
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Amen.
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: CRESSIDA
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: Amen.
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: PANDARUS
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: Amen. Whereupon I will show you a chamber with a
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: bed; which bed, because it shall not speak of your
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: pretty encounters, press it to death: away!
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: And Cupid grant all tongue-tied maidens here
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: Bed, chamber, Pandar to provide this gear!
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: CALCHAS
lines.speaker: CALCHAS

lines.value: Now, princes, for the service I have done you,
lines.speaker: CALCHAS

lines.value: The advantage of the time prompts me aloud
lines.speaker: CALCHAS

lines.value: To call for recompense. Appear it to your mind
lines.speaker: CALCHAS

lines.value: That, through the sight I bear in things to love,
lines.speaker: CALCHAS

lines.value: I have abandon'd Troy, left my possession,
lines.speaker: CALCHAS

lines.value: Incurr'd a traitor's name; exposed myself,
lines.speaker: CALCHAS

lines.value: From certain and possess'd conveniences,
lines.speaker: CALCHAS

lines.value: To doubtful fortunes; sequestering from me all
lines.speaker: CALCHAS

lines.value: That time, acquaintance, custom and condition
lines.speaker: CALCHAS

lines.value: Made tame and most familiar to my nature,
lines.speaker: CALCHAS

lines.value: And here, to do you service, am become
lines.speaker: CALCHAS

lines.value: As new into the world, strange, unacquainted:
lines.speaker: CALCHAS

lines.value: I do beseech you, as in way of taste,
lines.speaker: CALCHAS

lines.value: To give me now a little benefit,
lines.speaker: CALCHAS

lines.value: Out of those many register'd in promise,
lines.speaker: CALCHAS

lines.value: Which, you say, live to come in my behalf.
lines.speaker: CALCHAS

lines.value: AGAMEMNON
lines.speaker: AGAMEMNON

lines.value: What wouldst thou of us, Trojan? make demand.
lines.speaker: AGAMEMNON

lines.value: CALCHAS
lines.speaker: CALCHAS

lines.value: You have a Trojan prisoner, call'd Antenor,
lines.speaker: CALCHAS

lines.value: Yesterday took: Troy holds him very dear.
lines.speaker: CALCHAS

lines.value: Oft have you--often have you thanks therefore--
lines.speaker: CALCHAS

lines.value: Desired my Cressid in right great exchange,
lines.speaker: CALCHAS

lines.value: Whom Troy hath still denied: but this Antenor,
lines.speaker: CALCHAS

lines.value: I know, is such a wrest in their affairs
lines.speaker: CALCHAS

lines.value: That their negotiations all must slack,
lines.speaker: CALCHAS

lines.value: Wanting his manage; and they will almost
lines.speaker: CALCHAS

lines.value: Give us a prince of blood, a son of Priam,
lines.speaker: CALCHAS

lines.value: In change of him: let him be sent, great princes,
lines.speaker: CALCHAS

lines.value: And he shall buy my daughter; and her presence
lines.speaker: CALCHAS

lines.value: Shall quite strike off all service I have done,
lines.speaker: CALCHAS

lines.value: In most accepted pain.
lines.speaker: CALCHAS

lines.value: AGAMEMNON
lines.speaker: AGAMEMNON

lines.value: Let Diomedes bear him,
lines.speaker: AGAMEMNON

lines.value: And bring us Cressid hither: Calchas shall have
lines.speaker: AGAMEMNON

lines.value: What he requests of us. Good Diomed,
lines.speaker: AGAMEMNON

lines.value: Furnish you fairly for this interchange:
lines.speaker: AGAMEMNON

lines.value: Withal bring word if Hector will to-morrow
lines.speaker: AGAMEMNON

lines.value: Be answer'd in his challenge: Ajax is ready.
lines.speaker: AGAMEMNON

lines.value: DIOMEDES
lines.speaker: DIOMEDES

lines.value: This shall I undertake; and 'tis a burden
lines.speaker: DIOMEDES

lines.value: Which I am proud to bear.
lines.speaker: DIOMEDES

lines.value: ULYSSES
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: Achilles stands i' the entrance of his tent:
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: Please it our general to pass strangely by him,
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: As if he were forgot; and, princes all,
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: Lay negligent and loose regard upon him:
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: I will come last. 'Tis like he'll question me
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: Why such unplausive eyes are bent on him:
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: If so, I have derision medicinable,
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: To use between your strangeness and his pride,
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: Which his own will shall have desire to drink:
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: It may be good: pride hath no other glass
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: To show itself but pride, for supple knees
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: Feed arrogance and are the proud man's fees.
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: AGAMEMNON
lines.speaker: AGAMEMNON

lines.value: We'll execute your purpose, and put on
lines.speaker: AGAMEMNON

lines.value: A form of strangeness as we pass along:
lines.speaker: AGAMEMNON

lines.value: So do each lord, and either greet him not,
lines.speaker: AGAMEMNON

lines.value: Or else disdainfully, which shall shake him more
lines.speaker: AGAMEMNON

lines.value: Than if not look'd on. I will lead the way.
lines.speaker: AGAMEMNON

lines.value: ACHILLES
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: What, comes the general to speak with me?
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: You know my mind, I'll fight no more 'gainst Troy.
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: AGAMEMNON
lines.speaker: AGAMEMNON

lines.value: What says Achilles? would he aught with us?
lines.speaker: AGAMEMNON

lines.value: NESTOR
lines.speaker: NESTOR

lines.value: Would you, my lord, aught with the general?
lines.speaker: NESTOR

lines.value: ACHILLES
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: No.
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: NESTOR
lines.speaker: NESTOR

lines.value: Nothing, my lord.
lines.speaker: NESTOR

lines.value: AGAMEMNON
lines.speaker: AGAMEMNON

lines.value: The better.
lines.speaker: AGAMEMNON

lines.value: ACHILLES
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: Good day, good day.
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: MENELAUS
lines.speaker: MENELAUS

lines.value: How do you? how do you?
lines.speaker: MENELAUS

lines.value: ACHILLES
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: What, does the cuckold scorn me?
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: AJAX
lines.speaker: AJAX

lines.value: How now, Patroclus!
lines.speaker: AJAX

lines.value: ACHILLES
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: Good morrow, Ajax.
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: AJAX
lines.speaker: AJAX

lines.value: Ha?
lines.speaker: AJAX

lines.value: ACHILLES
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: Good morrow.
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: AJAX
lines.speaker: AJAX

lines.value: Ay, and good next day too.
lines.speaker: AJAX

lines.value: ACHILLES
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: What mean these fellows? Know they not Achilles?
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: PATROCLUS
lines.speaker: PATROCLUS

lines.value: They pass by strangely: they were used to bend
lines.speaker: PATROCLUS

lines.value: To send their smiles before them to Achilles;
lines.speaker: PATROCLUS

lines.value: To come as humbly as they used to creep
lines.speaker: PATROCLUS

lines.value: To holy altars.
lines.speaker: PATROCLUS

lines.value: ACHILLES
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: What, am I poor of late?
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: 'Tis certain, greatness, once fall'n out with fortune,
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: Must fall out with men too: what the declined is
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: He shall as soon read in the eyes of others
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: As feel in his own fall; for men, like butterflies,
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: Show not their mealy wings but to the summer,
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: And not a man, for being simply man,
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: Hath any honour, but honour for those honours
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: That are without him, as place, riches, favour,
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: Prizes of accident as oft as merit:
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: Which when they fall, as being slippery standers,
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: The love that lean'd on them as slippery too,
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: Do one pluck down another and together
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: Die in the fall. But 'tis not so with me:
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: Fortune and I are friends: I do enjoy
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: At ample point all that I did possess,
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: Save these men's looks; who do, methinks, find out
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: Something not worth in me such rich beholding
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: As they have often given. Here is Ulysses;
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: I'll interrupt his reading.
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: How now Ulysses!
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: ULYSSES
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: Now, great Thetis' son!
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: ACHILLES
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: What are you reading?
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: ULYSSES
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: A strange fellow here
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: Writes me: 'That man, how dearly ever parted,
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: How much in having, or without or in,
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: Cannot make boast to have that which he hath,
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: Nor feels not what he owes, but by reflection;
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: As when his virtues shining upon others
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: Heat them and they retort that heat again
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: To the first giver.'
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: ACHILLES
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: This is not strange, Ulysses.
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: The beauty that is borne here in the face
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: The bearer knows not, but commends itself
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: To others' eyes; nor doth the eye itself,
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: That most pure spirit of sense, behold itself,
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: Not going from itself; but eye to eye opposed
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: Salutes each other with each other's form;
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: For speculation turns not to itself,
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: Till it hath travell'd and is mirror'd there
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: Where it may see itself. This is not strange at all.
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: ULYSSES
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: I do not strain at the position,--
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: It is familiar,--but at the author's drift;
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: Who, in his circumstance, expressly proves
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: That no man is the lord of any thing,
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: Though in and of him there be much consisting,
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: Till he communicate his parts to others:
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: Nor doth he of himself know them for aught
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: Till he behold them form'd in the applause
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: Where they're extended; who, like an arch,
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: reverberates
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: The voice again, or, like a gate of steel
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: Fronting the sun, receives and renders back
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: His figure and his heat.  I was much wrapt in this;
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: And apprehended here immediately
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: The unknown Ajax.
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: Heavens, what a man is there! a very horse,
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: That has he knows not what. Nature, what things there are
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: Most abject in regard and dear in use!
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: What things again most dear in the esteem
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: And poor in worth! Now shall we see to-morrow--
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: An act that very chance doth throw upon him--
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: Ajax renown'd. O heavens, what some men do,
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: While some men leave to do!
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: How some men creep in skittish fortune's hall,
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: Whiles others play the idiots in her eyes!
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: How one man eats into another's pride,
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: While pride is fasting in his wantonness!
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: To see these Grecian lords!--why, even already
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: They clap the lubber Ajax on the shoulder,
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: As if his foot were on brave Hector's breast
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: And great Troy shrieking.
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: ACHILLES
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: I do believe it; for they pass'd by me
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: As misers do by beggars, neither gave to me
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: Good word nor look: what, are my deeds forgot?
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: ULYSSES
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: Time hath, my lord, a wallet at his back,
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: Wherein he puts alms for oblivion,
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: A great-sized monster of ingratitudes:
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: Those scraps are good deeds past; which are devour'd
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: As fast as they are made, forgot as soon
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: As done: perseverance, dear my lord,
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: Keeps honour bright: to have done is to hang
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: Quite out of fashion, like a rusty mail
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: In monumental mockery. Take the instant way;
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: For honour travels in a strait so narrow,
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: Where one but goes abreast: keep then the path;
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: For emulation hath a thousand sons
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: That one by one pursue: if you give way,
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: Or hedge aside from the direct forthright,
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: Like to an enter'd tide, they all rush by
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: And leave you hindmost;
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: Or like a gallant horse fall'n in first rank,
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: Lie there for pavement to the abject rear,
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: O'er-run and trampled on: then what they do in present,
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: Though less than yours in past, must o'ertop yours;
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: For time is like a fashionable host
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: That slightly shakes his parting guest by the hand,
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: And with his arms outstretch'd, as he would fly,
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: Grasps in the comer: welcome ever smiles,
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: And farewell goes out sighing. O, let not
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: virtue seek
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: Remuneration for the thing it was;
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: For beauty, wit,
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: High birth, vigour of bone, desert in service,
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: Love, friendship, charity, are subjects all
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: To envious and calumniating time.
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: One touch of nature makes the whole world kin,
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: That all with one consent praise new-born gawds,
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: Though they are made and moulded of things past,
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: And give to dust that is a little gilt
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: More laud than gilt o'er-dusted.
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: The present eye praises the present object.
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: Then marvel not, thou great and complete man,
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: That all the Greeks begin to worship Ajax;
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: Since things in motion sooner catch the eye
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: Than what not stirs. The cry went once on thee,
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: And still it might, and yet it may again,
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: If thou wouldst not entomb thyself alive
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: And case thy reputation in thy tent;
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: Whose glorious deeds, but in these fields of late,
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: Made emulous missions 'mongst the gods themselves
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: And drave great Mars to faction.
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: ACHILLES
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: Of this my privacy
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: I have strong reasons.
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: ULYSSES
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: But 'gainst your privacy
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: The reasons are more potent and heroical:
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: 'Tis known, Achilles, that you are in love
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: With one of Priam's daughters.
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: ACHILLES
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: Ha! known!
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: ULYSSES
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: Is that a wonder?
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: The providence that's in a watchful state
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: Knows almost every grain of Plutus' gold,
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: Finds bottom in the uncomprehensive deeps,
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: Keeps place with thought and almost, like the gods,
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: Does thoughts unveil in their dumb cradles.
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: There is a mystery--with whom relation
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: Durst never meddle--in the soul of state;
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: Which hath an operation more divine
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: Than breath or pen can give expressure to:
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: All the commerce that you have had with Troy
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: As perfectly is ours as yours, my lord;
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: And better would it fit Achilles much
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: To throw down Hector than Polyxena:
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: But it must grieve young Pyrrhus now at home,
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: When fame shall in our islands sound her trump,
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: And all the Greekish girls shall tripping sing,
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: 'Great Hector's sister did Achilles win,
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: But our great Ajax bravely beat down him.'
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: Farewell, my lord: I as your lover speak;
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: The fool slides o'er the ice that you should break.
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: PATROCLUS
lines.speaker: PATROCLUS

lines.value: To this effect, Achilles, have I moved you:
lines.speaker: PATROCLUS

lines.value: A woman impudent and mannish grown
lines.speaker: PATROCLUS

lines.value: In time of action. I stand condemn'd for this;
lines.speaker: PATROCLUS

lines.value: They think my little stomach to the war

lines.value: And your great love to me restrains you thus:
lines.speaker: PATROCLUS

lines.value: Sweet, rouse yourself; and the weak wanton Cupid
lines.speaker: PATROCLUS

lines.value: Shall from your neck unloose his amorous fold,
lines.speaker: PATROCLUS

lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: AENEAS
lines.speaker: AENEAS

lines.value: Is not Prince Troilus here?
lines.speaker: AENEAS

lines.value: PANDARUS
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: Here! what should he do here?
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: AENEAS
lines.speaker: AENEAS

lines.value: Come, he is here, my lord; do not deny him:
lines.speaker: AENEAS

lines.value: It doth import him much to speak with me.
lines.speaker: AENEAS

lines.value: PANDARUS
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: Is he here, say you? 'tis more than I know, I'll
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: be sworn: for my own part, I came in late. What
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: should he do here?
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: AENEAS
lines.speaker: AENEAS

lines.value: Who!--nay, then: come, come, you'll do him wrong
lines.speaker: AENEAS

lines.value: ere you're ware: you'll be so true to him, to be
lines.speaker: AENEAS

lines.value: false to him: do not you know of him, but yet go
lines.speaker: AENEAS

lines.value: fetch him hither; go.
lines.speaker: AENEAS

lines.value: TROILUS
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: How now! what's the matter?
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: AENEAS
lines.speaker: AENEAS

lines.value: My lord, I scarce have leisure to salute you,
lines.speaker: AENEAS

lines.value: My matter is so rash: there is at hand
lines.speaker: AENEAS

lines.value: Paris your brother, and Deiphobus,
lines.speaker: AENEAS

lines.value: The Grecian Diomed, and our Antenor
lines.speaker: AENEAS

lines.value: Deliver'd to us; and for him forthwith,
lines.speaker: AENEAS

lines.value: Ere the first sacrifice, within this hour,
lines.speaker: AENEAS

lines.value: We must give up to Diomedes' hand
lines.speaker: AENEAS

lines.value: The Lady Cressida.
lines.speaker: AENEAS

lines.value: TROILUS
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Is it so concluded?
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: AENEAS
lines.speaker: AENEAS

lines.value: By Priam and the general state of Troy:
lines.speaker: AENEAS

lines.value: They are at hand and ready to effect it.
lines.speaker: AENEAS

lines.value: TROILUS
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: How my achievements mock me!
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: I will go meet them: and, my Lord AEneas,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: We met by chance; you did not find me here.
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: AENEAS
lines.speaker: AENEAS

lines.value: Good, good, my lord; the secrets of nature
lines.speaker: AENEAS

lines.value: Have not more gift in taciturnity.
lines.speaker: AENEAS

lines.value: PANDARUS
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: Is't possible? no sooner got but lost? The devil
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: take Antenor! the young prince will go mad: a
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: plague upon Antenor! I would they had broke 's neck!
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: CRESSIDA
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: How now! what's the matter? who was here?
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: PANDARUS
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: Ah, ah!
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: CRESSIDA
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: Why sigh you so profoundly? where's my lord? gone!
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: Tell me, sweet uncle, what's the matter?
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: PANDARUS
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: Would I were as deep under the earth as I am above!
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: CRESSIDA
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: O the gods! what's the matter?
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: PANDARUS
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: Prithee, get thee in: would thou hadst ne'er been
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: born! I knew thou wouldst be his death. O, poor
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: gentleman! A plague upon Antenor!
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: CRESSIDA
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: Good uncle, I beseech you, on my knees! beseech you,
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: what's the matter?
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: PANDARUS
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: Thou must be gone, wench, thou must be gone; thou
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: art changed for Antenor: thou must to thy father,
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: and be gone from Troilus: 'twill be his death;
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: 'twill be his bane; he cannot bear it.
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: CRESSIDA
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: O you immortal gods! I will not go.
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: PANDARUS
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: Thou must.
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: CRESSIDA
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: I will not, uncle: I have forgot my father;
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: I know no touch of consanguinity;
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: No kin no love, no blood, no soul so near me
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: As the sweet Troilus. O you gods divine!
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: Make Cressid's name the very crown of falsehood,
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: If ever she leave Troilus! Time, force, and death,
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: Do to this body what extremes you can;
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: But the strong base and building of my love
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: Is as the very centre of the earth,
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: Drawing all things to it. I'll go in and weep,--
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: PANDARUS
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: Do, do.
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: CRESSIDA
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: Tear my bright hair and scratch my praised cheeks,
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: Crack my clear voice with sobs and break my heart
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: With sounding Troilus. I will not go from Troy.
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: PARIS
lines.speaker: PARIS

lines.value: It is great morning, and the hour prefix'd
lines.speaker: PARIS

lines.value: Of her delivery to this valiant Greek
lines.speaker: PARIS

lines.value: Comes fast upon. Good my brother Troilus,
lines.speaker: PARIS

lines.value: Tell you the lady what she is to do,
lines.speaker: PARIS

lines.value: And haste her to the purpose.
lines.speaker: PARIS

lines.value: TROILUS
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Walk into her house;
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: I'll bring her to the Grecian presently:
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: And to his hand when I deliver her,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Think it an altar, and thy brother Troilus
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: A priest there offering to it his own heart.
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: PARIS
lines.speaker: PARIS

lines.value: I know what 'tis to love;
lines.speaker: PARIS

lines.value: And would, as I shall pity, I could help!
lines.speaker: PARIS

lines.value: Please you walk in, my lords.
lines.speaker: PARIS

lines.value: PANDARUS
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: Be moderate, be moderate.
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: CRESSIDA
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: Why tell you me of moderation?
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: The grief is fine, full, perfect, that I taste,
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: And violenteth in a sense as strong
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: As that which causeth it: how can I moderate it?
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: If I could temporize with my affection,
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: Or brew it to a weak and colder palate,
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: The like allayment could I give my grief.
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: My love admits no qualifying dross;
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: No more my grief, in such a precious loss.
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: PANDARUS
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: Here, here, here he comes.
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: Ah, sweet ducks!
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: CRESSIDA
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: O Troilus! Troilus!
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: PANDARUS
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: What a pair of spectacles is here!
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: Let me embrace too. 'O heart,' as the goodly saying is,
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: '--O heart, heavy heart,
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: Why sigh'st thou without breaking?
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: where he answers again,
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: 'Because thou canst not ease thy smart
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: By friendship nor by speaking.'
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: There was never a truer rhyme. Let us cast away
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: nothing, for we may live to have need of such a
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: verse: we see it, we see it. How now, lambs?
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: TROILUS
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Cressid, I love thee in so strain'd a purity,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: That the bless'd gods, as angry with my fancy,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: More bright in zeal than the devotion which
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Cold lips blow to their deities, take thee from me.
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: CRESSIDA
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: Have the gods envy?
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: PANDARUS
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: Ay, ay, ay, ay; 'tis too plain a case.
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: CRESSIDA
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: And is it true that I must go from Troy?
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: TROILUS
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: A hateful truth.
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: CRESSIDA
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: What, and from Troilus too?
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: TROILUS
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: From Troy and Troilus.
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: CRESSIDA
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: Is it possible?
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: TROILUS
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: And suddenly; where injury of chance
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Puts back leave-taking, justles roughly by
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: All time of pause, rudely beguiles our lips
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Of all rejoindure, forcibly prevents
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Our lock'd embrasures, strangles our dear vows
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Even in the birth of our own labouring breath:
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: We two, that with so many thousand sighs
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Did buy each other, must poorly sell ourselves
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: With the rude brevity and discharge of one.
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Injurious time now with a robber's haste
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Crams his rich thievery up, he knows not how:
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: As many farewells as be stars in heaven,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: With distinct breath and consign'd kisses to them,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: He fumbles up into a lose adieu,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: And scants us with a single famish'd kiss,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Distasted with the salt of broken tears.
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: AENEAS
lines.speaker: AENEAS

lines.value: [Within]  My lord, is the lady ready?
lines.speaker: AENEAS

lines.value: TROILUS
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Hark! you are call'd: some say the Genius so
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Cries 'come' to him that instantly must die.
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Bid them have patience; she shall come anon.
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: PANDARUS
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: Where are my tears? rain, to lay this wind, or
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: my heart will be blown up by the root.
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: CRESSIDA
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: I must then to the Grecians?
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: TROILUS
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: No remedy.
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: CRESSIDA
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: A woful Cressid 'mongst the merry Greeks!
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: When shall we see again?
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: TROILUS
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Hear me, my love: be thou but true of heart,--
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: CRESSIDA
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: I true! how now! what wicked deem is this?
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: TROILUS
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Nay, we must use expostulation kindly,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: For it is parting from us:
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: I speak not 'be thou true,' as fearing thee,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: For I will throw my glove to Death himself,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: That there's no maculation in thy heart:
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: But 'be thou true,' say I, to fashion in
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: My sequent protestation; be thou true,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: And I will see thee.
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: CRESSIDA
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: O, you shall be exposed, my lord, to dangers
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: As infinite as imminent! but I'll be true.
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: TROILUS
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: And I'll grow friend with danger. Wear this sleeve.
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: CRESSIDA
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: And you this glove. When shall I see you?
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: TROILUS
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: I will corrupt the Grecian sentinels,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: To give thee nightly visitation.
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: But yet be true.
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: CRESSIDA
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: O heavens! 'be true' again!
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: TROILUS
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Hear while I speak it, love:
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: The Grecian youths are full of quality;
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: They're loving, well composed with gifts of nature,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Flowing and swelling o'er with arts and exercise:
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: How novelty may move, and parts with person,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Alas, a kind of godly jealousy--
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Which, I beseech you, call a virtuous sin--
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Makes me afeard.
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: CRESSIDA
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: O heavens! you love me not.
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: TROILUS
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Die I a villain, then!
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: In this I do not call your faith in question
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: So mainly as my merit: I cannot sing,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Nor heel the high lavolt, nor sweeten talk,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Nor play at subtle games; fair virtues all,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: To which the Grecians are most prompt and pregnant:
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: But I can tell that in each grace of these
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: There lurks a still and dumb-discoursive devil
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: That tempts most cunningly: but be not tempted.
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: CRESSIDA
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: Do you think I will?
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: TROILUS
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: No.
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: But something may be done that we will not:
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: And sometimes we are devils to ourselves,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: When we will tempt the frailty of our powers,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Presuming on their changeful potency.
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: AENEAS
lines.speaker: AENEAS

lines.value: [Within]  Nay, good my lord,--
lines.speaker: AENEAS

lines.value: TROILUS
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Come, kiss; and let us part.
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: PARIS
lines.speaker: PARIS

lines.value: [Within]  Brother Troilus!
lines.speaker: PARIS

lines.value: TROILUS
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Good brother, come you hither;
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: And bring AEneas and the Grecian with you.
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: CRESSIDA
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: My lord, will you be true?
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: TROILUS
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Who, I? alas, it is my vice, my fault:
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Whiles others fish with craft for great opinion,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: I with great truth catch mere simplicity;
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Whilst some with cunning gild their copper crowns,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: With truth and plainness I do wear mine bare.
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Fear not my truth: the moral of my wit
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Is 'plain and true;' there's all the reach of it.
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Welcome, Sir Diomed! here is the lady
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Which for Antenor we deliver you:
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: At the port, lord, I'll give her to thy hand,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: And by the way possess thee what she is.
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Entreat her fair; and, by my soul, fair Greek,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: If e'er thou stand at mercy of my sword,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Name Cressida and thy life shall be as safe
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: As Priam is in Ilion.
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: DIOMEDES
lines.speaker: DIOMEDES

lines.value: Fair Lady Cressid,
lines.speaker: DIOMEDES

lines.value: So please you, save the thanks this prince expects:
lines.speaker: DIOMEDES

lines.value: The lustre in your eye, heaven in your cheek,
lines.speaker: DIOMEDES

lines.value: Pleads your fair usage; and to Diomed
lines.speaker: DIOMEDES

lines.value: You shall be mistress, and command him wholly.
lines.speaker: DIOMEDES

lines.value: TROILUS
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Grecian, thou dost not use me courteously,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: To shame the zeal of my petition to thee
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: In praising her: I tell thee, lord of Greece,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: She is as far high-soaring o'er thy praises
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: As thou unworthy to be call'd her servant.
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: I charge thee use her well, even for my charge;
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: For, by the dreadful Pluto, if thou dost not,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Though the great bulk Achilles be thy guard,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: I'll cut thy throat.
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: DIOMEDES
lines.speaker: DIOMEDES

lines.value: O, be not moved, Prince Troilus:
lines.speaker: DIOMEDES

lines.value: Let me be privileged by my place and message,
lines.speaker: DIOMEDES

lines.value: To be a speaker free; when I am hence
lines.speaker: DIOMEDES

lines.value: I'll answer to my lust: and know you, lord,
lines.speaker: DIOMEDES

lines.value: I'll nothing do on charge: to her own worth
lines.speaker: DIOMEDES

lines.value: She shall be prized; but that you say 'be't so,'
lines.speaker: DIOMEDES

lines.value: I'll speak it in my spirit and honour, 'no.'
lines.speaker: DIOMEDES

lines.value: TROILUS
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Come, to the port. I'll tell thee, Diomed,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: This brave shall oft make thee to hide thy head.
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Lady, give me your hand, and, as we walk,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: To our own selves bend we our needful talk.
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: PARIS
lines.speaker: PARIS

lines.value: Hark! Hector's trumpet.
lines.speaker: PARIS

lines.value: AENEAS
lines.speaker: AENEAS

lines.value: How have we spent this morning!
lines.speaker: AENEAS

lines.value: The prince must think me tardy and remiss,
lines.speaker: AENEAS

lines.value: That sore to ride before him to the field.
lines.speaker: AENEAS

lines.value: PARIS
lines.speaker: PARIS

lines.value: 'Tis Troilus' fault: come, come, to field with him.
lines.speaker: PARIS

lines.value: DEIPHOBUS
lines.speaker: DEIPHOBUS

lines.value: Let us make ready straight.
lines.speaker: DEIPHOBUS

lines.value: AENEAS
lines.speaker: AENEAS

lines.value: Yea, with a bridegroom's fresh alacrity,
lines.speaker: AENEAS

lines.value: Let us address to tend on Hector's heels:
lines.speaker: AENEAS

lines.value: The glory of our Troy doth this day lie
lines.speaker: AENEAS

lines.value: On his fair worth and single chivalry.
lines.speaker: AENEAS

lines.value: AGAMEMNON
lines.speaker: AGAMEMNON

lines.value: Here art thou in appointment fresh and fair,
lines.speaker: AGAMEMNON

lines.value: Anticipating time with starting courage.
lines.speaker: AGAMEMNON

lines.value: Give with thy trumpet a loud note to Troy,
lines.speaker: AGAMEMNON

lines.value: Thou dreadful Ajax; that the appalled air
lines.speaker: AGAMEMNON

lines.value: May pierce the head of the great combatant
lines.speaker: AGAMEMNON

lines.value: And hale him hither.
lines.speaker: AGAMEMNON

lines.value: AJAX
lines.speaker: AJAX

lines.value: Thou, trumpet, there's my purse.
lines.speaker: AJAX

lines.value: Now crack thy lungs, and split thy brazen pipe:
lines.speaker: AJAX

lines.value: Blow, villain, till thy sphered bias cheek
lines.speaker: AJAX

lines.value: Outswell the colic of puff'd Aquilon:
lines.speaker: AJAX

lines.value: Come, stretch thy chest and let thy eyes spout blood;

lines.value: Thou blow'st for Hector.

lines.speaker: MENELAUS

lines.speaker: MENELAUS

lines.value: CRESSIDA
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: ULYSSES

lines.value: NESTOR
lines.speaker: NESTOR

lines.value: ULYSSES
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: Fie, fie upon her!
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: There's language in her eye, her cheek, her lip,
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: Nay, her foot speaks; her wanton spirits look out
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: At every joint and motive of her body.
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: O, these encounterers, so glib of tongue,
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: AENEAS

lines.value: ACHILLES
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: 'Tis done like Hector; but securely done,

lines.value: AENEAS
lines.speaker: AENEAS

lines.value: If not Achilles, sir,

lines.value: ACHILLES
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: If not Achilles, nothing.
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: AENEAS
lines.speaker: AENEAS

lines.value: Therefore Achilles: but, whate'er, know this:
lines.speaker: AENEAS

lines.value: In the extremity of great and little,
lines.speaker: AENEAS

lines.value: Valour and pride excel themselves in Hector;
lines.speaker: AENEAS

lines.value: The one almost as infinite as all,

lines.speaker: AENEAS

lines.speaker: AENEAS

lines.speaker: AENEAS

lines.value: In love whereof, half Hector stays at home;

lines.value: ACHILLES

lines.value: AGAMEMNON

lines.value: Consent upon the order of their fight,
lines.speaker: AGAMEMNON

lines.value: So be it; either to the uttermost,

lines.speaker: AGAMEMNON

lines.value: ULYSSES

lines.value: AGAMEMNON
lines.speaker: AGAMEMNON

lines.value: What Trojan is that same that looks so heavy?

lines.value: ULYSSES
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: The youngest son of Priam, a true knight,
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: Not yet mature, yet matchless, firm of word,
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: Speaking in deeds and deedless in his tongue;
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: Not soon provoked nor being provoked soon calm'd:
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: His heart and hand both open and both free;
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: For what he has he gives, what thinks he shows;
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: Yet gives he not till judgment guide his bounty,
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: Nor dignifies an impure thought with breath;
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: Manly as Hector, but more dangerous;
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: For Hector in his blaze of wrath subscribes
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: To tender objects, but he in heat of action
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: Is more vindicative than jealous love:
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: They call him Troilus, and on him erect
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: A second hope, as fairly built as Hector.
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: Thus says AEneas; one that knows the youth
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: Even to his inches, and with private soul
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: Did in great Ilion thus translate him to me.
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: Runs on the dexter cheek, and this sinister

lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: HECTOR

lines.value: AGAMEMNON
lines.speaker: AGAMEMNON

lines.value: And formless ruin of oblivion;

lines.value: Bids thee, with most divine integrity,

lines.value: MENELAUS
lines.speaker: MENELAUS

lines.value: HECTOR
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: O, pardon; I offend.
