lines.value: NESTOR
lines.speaker: NESTOR

lines.value: I have, thou gallant Trojan, seen thee oft
lines.speaker: NESTOR

lines.value: Labouring for destiny make cruel way
lines.speaker: NESTOR

lines.value: Through ranks of Greekish youth, and I have seen thee,
lines.speaker: NESTOR

lines.value: As hot as Perseus, spur thy Phrygian steed,
lines.speaker: NESTOR

lines.value: Despising many forfeits and subduements,
lines.speaker: NESTOR

lines.value: When thou hast hung thy advanced sword i' the air,
lines.speaker: NESTOR

lines.value: Not letting it decline on the declined,
lines.speaker: NESTOR

lines.value: That I have said to some my standers by
lines.speaker: NESTOR

lines.value: 'Lo, Jupiter is yonder, dealing life!'
lines.speaker: NESTOR

lines.value: And I have seen thee pause and take thy breath,
lines.speaker: NESTOR

lines.value: When that a ring of Greeks have hemm'd thee in,
lines.speaker: NESTOR

lines.value: Like an Olympian wrestling: this have I seen;
lines.speaker: NESTOR

lines.value: But this thy countenance, still lock'd in steel,
lines.speaker: NESTOR

lines.value: I never saw till now. I knew thy grandsire,
lines.speaker: NESTOR

lines.value: And once fought with him: he was a soldier good;
lines.speaker: NESTOR

lines.value: But, by great Mars, the captain of us all,
lines.speaker: NESTOR

lines.value: Never saw like thee. Let an old man embrace thee;
lines.speaker: NESTOR

lines.value: And, worthy warrior, welcome to our tents.
lines.speaker: NESTOR

lines.value: AENEAS

lines.value: 'Tis the old Nestor.

lines.value: HECTOR
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: Let me embrace thee, good old chronicle,

lines.value: That hast so long walk'd hand in hand with time:
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: Most reverend Nestor, I am glad to clasp thee.
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: NESTOR
lines.speaker: NESTOR

lines.value: I would my arms could match thee in contention,
lines.speaker: NESTOR

lines.value: As they contend with thee in courtesy.

lines.value: HECTOR

lines.value: I would they could.

lines.value: NESTOR
lines.speaker: NESTOR

lines.value: Ha!

lines.value: By this white beard, I'ld fight with thee to-morrow.

lines.value: Well, welcome, welcome! I have seen the time.

lines.value: ULYSSES

lines.value: I wonder now how yonder city stands
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: When we have here her base and pillar by us.

lines.value: HECTOR

lines.value: I know your favour, Lord Ulysses, well.

lines.value: Ah, sir, there's many a Greek and Trojan dead,
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: Since first I saw yourself and Diomed
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: In Ilion, on your Greekish embassy.
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: ULYSSES
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: Sir, I foretold you then what would ensue:
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: My prophecy is but half his journey yet;
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: For yonder walls, that pertly front your town,
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: Yond towers, whose wanton tops do buss the clouds,
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: Must kiss their own feet.
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: HECTOR
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: I must not believe you:
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: There they stand yet, and modestly I think,
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: The fall of every Phrygian stone will cost
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: A drop of Grecian blood: the end crowns all,
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: And that old common arbitrator, Time,
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: Will one day end it.
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: ULYSSES
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: So to him we leave it.
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: Most gentle and most valiant Hector, welcome:
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: After the general, I beseech you next
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: ACHILLES

lines.value: I shall forestall thee, Lord Ulysses, thou!
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: Now, Hector, I have fed mine eyes on thee;
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: I have with exact view perused thee, Hector,
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: And quoted joint by joint.
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: HECTOR
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: Is this Achilles?
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: ACHILLES
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: I am Achilles.
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: HECTOR
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: Stand fair, I pray thee: let me look on thee.
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: ACHILLES
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: Behold thy fill.
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: HECTOR
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: Nay, I have done already.
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: ACHILLES
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: Thou art too brief: I will the second time,
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: As I would buy thee, view thee limb by limb.
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: HECTOR
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: O, like a book of sport thou'lt read me o'er;
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: But there's more in me than thou understand'st.
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: Why dost thou so oppress me with thine eye?
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: ACHILLES
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: Tell me, you heavens, in which part of his body
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: Shall I destroy him? whether there, or there, or there?
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: That I may give the local wound a name
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: And make distinct the very breach whereout
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: Hector's great spirit flew: answer me, heavens!
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: HECTOR
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: It would discredit the blest gods, proud man,
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: To answer such a question: stand again:
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: Think'st thou to catch my life so pleasantly
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: As to prenominate in nice conjecture
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: Where thou wilt hit me dead?
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: ACHILLES
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: I tell thee, yea.
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: HECTOR
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: Wert thou an oracle to tell me so,
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: I'd not believe thee. Henceforth guard thee well;
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: For I'll not kill thee there, nor there, nor there;
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: But, by the forge that stithied Mars his helm,
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: I'll kill thee every where, yea, o'er and o'er.
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: You wisest Grecians, pardon me this brag;
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: His insolence draws folly from my lips;
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: But I'll endeavour deeds to match these words,
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: Or may I never--
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: AJAX
lines.speaker: AJAX

lines.value: Do not chafe thee, cousin:
lines.speaker: AJAX

lines.value: And you, Achilles, let these threats alone,
lines.speaker: AJAX

lines.value: Till accident or purpose bring you to't:
lines.speaker: AJAX

lines.value: You may have every day enough of Hector
lines.speaker: AJAX

lines.value: If you have stomach; the general state, I fear,
lines.speaker: AJAX

lines.value: Can scarce entreat you to be odd with him.
lines.speaker: AJAX

lines.value: HECTOR
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: I pray you, let us see you in the field:
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: We have had pelting wars, since you refused
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: The Grecians' cause.
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: ACHILLES
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: Dost thou entreat me, Hector?
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: To-morrow do I meet thee, fell as death;
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: To-night all friends.
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: HECTOR
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: Thy hand upon that match.

lines.speaker: AGAMEMNON

lines.speaker: AGAMEMNON

lines.speaker: AGAMEMNON

lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: Who neither looks upon the heaven nor earth,

lines.value: TROILUS
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Shall sweet lord, be bound to you so much,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: After we part from Agamemnon's tent,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: To bring me thither?
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: ULYSSES
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: You shall command me, sir.
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: As gentle tell me, of what honour was
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: This Cressida in Troy? Had she no lover there
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: That wails her absence?
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: TROILUS
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: O, sir, to such as boasting show their scars
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: A mock is due. Will you walk on, my lord?
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: She was beloved, she loved; she is, and doth:
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: But still sweet love is food for fortune's tooth.
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: ACHILLES

lines.value: PATROCLUS

lines.value: Well said, adversity! and what need these tricks?
lines.speaker: PATROCLUS

lines.value: THERSITES
lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.value: Prithee, be silent, boy; I profit not by thy talk:
lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.value: thou art thought to be Achilles' male varlet.
lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.value: PATROCLUS
lines.speaker: PATROCLUS

lines.value: Male varlet, you rogue! what's that?
lines.speaker: PATROCLUS

lines.value: THERSITES
lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.value: Why, his masculine whore. Now, the rotten diseases
lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.value: of the south, the guts-griping, ruptures, catarrhs,
lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.value: loads o' gravel i' the back, lethargies, cold
lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.value: palsies, raw eyes, dirt-rotten livers, wheezing
lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.value: lungs, bladders full of imposthume, sciaticas,
lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.value: limekilns i' the palm, incurable bone-ache, and the
lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.value: rivelled fee-simple of the tetter, take and take
lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.value: again such preposterous discoveries!
lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.value: PATROCLUS
lines.speaker: PATROCLUS

lines.value: Why thou damnable box of envy, thou, what meanest

lines.value: thou to curse thus?
lines.speaker: PATROCLUS

lines.value: THERSITES

lines.speaker: PATROCLUS

lines.value: Why no, you ruinous butt, you whoreson

lines.value: indistinguishable cur, no.
lines.speaker: PATROCLUS

lines.value: THERSITES
lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.value: No! why art thou then exasperate, thou idle
lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.value: flap for a sore eye, thou tassel of a prodigal's
lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.value: purse, thou? Ah, how the poor world is pestered
lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.value: PATROCLUS

lines.value: Out, gall!

lines.value: ACHILLES
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: My sweet Patroclus, I am thwarted quite
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: From my great purpose in to-morrow's battle.
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: Here is a letter from Queen Hecuba,
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: A token from her daughter, my fair love,
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: Both taxing me and gaging me to keep
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: An oath that I have sworn. I will not break it:
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: Fall Greeks; fail fame; honour or go or stay;
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: My major vow lies here, this I'll obey.
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: Come, come, Thersites, help to trim my tent:
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: Away, Patroclus!
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: THERSITES
lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.value: With too much blood and too little brain, these two
lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.value: may run mad; but, if with too much brain and too
lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.value: little blood they do, I'll be a curer of madmen.
lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.value: Here's Agamemnon, an honest fellow enough and one
lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.value: that loves quails; but he has not so much brain as
lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.value: earwax: and the goodly transformation of Jupiter
lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.value: there, his brother, the bull,--the primitive statue,
lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.value: and oblique memorial of cuckolds; a thrifty
lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.value: shoeing-horn in a chain, hanging at his brother's
lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.value: leg,--to what form but that he is, should wit larded
lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.value: with malice and malice forced with wit turn him to?
lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.value: To an ass, were nothing; he is both ass and ox: to
lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.value: an ox, were nothing; he is both ox and ass. To be a
lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.value: dog, a mule, a cat, a fitchew, a toad, a lizard, an
lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.value: owl, a puttock, or a herring without a roe, I would
lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.value: not care; but to be Menelaus, I would conspire
lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.value: against destiny. Ask me not, what I would be, if I

lines.value: were not Thersites; for I care not to be the louse
lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.value: of a lazar, so I were not Menelaus! Hey-day!
lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.value: spirits and fires!

lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: TROILUS
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Doth that grieve thee?
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: O wither'd truth!
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: ULYSSES
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: Why, how now, lord!
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: TROILUS
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: By Jove,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: I will be patient.
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: CRESSIDA
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: Guardian!--why, Greek!
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: DIOMEDES
lines.speaker: DIOMEDES

lines.value: Foh, foh! adieu; you palter.
lines.speaker: DIOMEDES

lines.value: CRESSIDA
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: In faith, I do not: come hither once again.
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: ULYSSES
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: You shake, my lord, at something: will you go?
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: You will break out.
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: TROILUS
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: She strokes his cheek!
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: ULYSSES
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: Come, come.
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: TROILUS
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Nay, stay; by Jove, I will not speak a word:
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: There is between my will and all offences
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: A guard of patience: stay a little while.
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: THERSITES
lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.value: How the devil Luxury, with his fat rump and
lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.value: potato-finger, tickles these together! Fry, lechery, fry!
lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.value: DIOMEDES
lines.speaker: DIOMEDES

lines.value: But will you, then?
lines.speaker: DIOMEDES

lines.value: CRESSIDA
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: In faith, I will, la; never trust me else.
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: DIOMEDES
lines.speaker: DIOMEDES

lines.value: Give me some token for the surety of it.
lines.speaker: DIOMEDES

lines.value: CRESSIDA
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: I'll fetch you one.
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: ULYSSES
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: You have sworn patience.
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: TROILUS
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Fear me not, sweet lord;
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: I will not be myself, nor have cognition
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Of what I feel: I am all patience.
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: THERSITES
lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.value: Now the pledge; now, now, now!
lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.value: CRESSIDA
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: Here, Diomed, keep this sleeve.
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: TROILUS
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: O beauty! where is thy faith?
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: ULYSSES
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: My lord,--
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: TROILUS
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: I will be patient; outwardly I will.
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: CRESSIDA
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: You look upon that sleeve; behold it well.
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: He loved me--O false wench!--Give't me again.
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: DIOMEDES
lines.speaker: DIOMEDES

lines.value: Whose was't?
lines.speaker: DIOMEDES

lines.value: CRESSIDA
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: It is no matter, now I have't again.
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: I will not meet with you to-morrow night:
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: I prithee, Diomed, visit me no more.
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: THERSITES
lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.value: Now she sharpens: well said, whetstone!
lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.value: DIOMEDES
lines.speaker: DIOMEDES

lines.value: I shall have it.
lines.speaker: DIOMEDES

lines.value: CRESSIDA
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: What, this?
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: DIOMEDES
lines.speaker: DIOMEDES

lines.value: Ay, that.
lines.speaker: DIOMEDES

lines.value: CRESSIDA
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: O, all you gods! O pretty, pretty pledge!
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: Thy master now lies thinking in his bed
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: Of thee and me, and sighs, and takes my glove,
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: And gives memorial dainty kisses to it,
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: As I kiss thee. Nay, do not snatch it from me;
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: He that takes that doth take my heart withal.
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: DIOMEDES
lines.speaker: DIOMEDES

lines.value: I had your heart before, this follows it.
lines.speaker: DIOMEDES

lines.value: TROILUS
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: I did swear patience.
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: CRESSIDA
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: You shall not have it, Diomed; faith, you shall not;
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: I'll give you something else.
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: DIOMEDES
lines.speaker: DIOMEDES

lines.value: I will have this: whose was it?
lines.speaker: DIOMEDES

lines.value: CRESSIDA
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: It is no matter.
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: DIOMEDES
lines.speaker: DIOMEDES

lines.value: Come, tell me whose it was.
lines.speaker: DIOMEDES

lines.value: CRESSIDA
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: 'Twas one's that loved me better than you will.
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: But, now you have it, take it.
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: DIOMEDES
lines.speaker: DIOMEDES

lines.value: Whose was it?
lines.speaker: DIOMEDES

lines.value: CRESSIDA
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: By all Diana's waiting-women yond,
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: And by herself, I will not tell you whose.
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: DIOMEDES
lines.speaker: DIOMEDES

lines.value: To-morrow will I wear it on my helm,
lines.speaker: DIOMEDES

lines.value: And grieve his spirit that dares not challenge it.
lines.speaker: DIOMEDES

lines.value: TROILUS
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Wert thou the devil, and worest it on thy horn,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: It should be challenged.
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: CRESSIDA
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: Well, well, 'tis done, 'tis past: and yet it is not;
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: I will not keep my word.
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: DIOMEDES
lines.speaker: DIOMEDES

lines.value: Why, then, farewell;
lines.speaker: DIOMEDES

lines.value: Thou never shalt mock Diomed again.
lines.speaker: DIOMEDES

lines.value: CRESSIDA
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: You shall not go: one cannot speak a word,
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: But it straight starts you.
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: DIOMEDES
lines.speaker: DIOMEDES

lines.value: I do not like this fooling.
lines.speaker: DIOMEDES

lines.value: THERSITES
lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.value: Nor I, by Pluto: but that that likes not you pleases me best.
lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.value: DIOMEDES
lines.speaker: DIOMEDES

lines.value: What, shall I come? the hour?
lines.speaker: DIOMEDES

lines.value: CRESSIDA
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: Ay, come:--O Jove!--do come:--I shall be plagued.
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: DIOMEDES
lines.speaker: DIOMEDES

lines.value: Farewell till then.
lines.speaker: DIOMEDES

lines.value: CRESSIDA
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: Good night: I prithee, come.
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: Troilus, farewell! one eye yet looks on thee
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: But with my heart the other eye doth see.
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: Ah, poor our sex! this fault in us I find,
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: The error of our eye directs our mind:
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: What error leads must err; O, then conclude
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: Minds sway'd by eyes are full of turpitude.
lines.speaker: CRESSIDA

lines.value: THERSITES
lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.value: A proof of strength she could not publish more,
lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.value: Unless she said ' My mind is now turn'd whore.'
lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.value: ULYSSES
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: All's done, my lord.
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: TROILUS
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: It is.
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: ULYSSES
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: Why stay we, then?
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: TROILUS
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: To make a recordation to my soul
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Of every syllable that here was spoke.
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: But if I tell how these two did co-act,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Shall I not lie in publishing a truth?
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Sith yet there is a credence in my heart,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: An esperance so obstinately strong,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: That doth invert the attest of eyes and ears,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: As if those organs had deceptious functions,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Created only to calumniate.
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Was Cressid here?
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: ULYSSES
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: I cannot conjure, Trojan.
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: TROILUS
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: She was not, sure.
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: ULYSSES
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: Most sure she was.
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: TROILUS
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Why, my negation hath no taste of madness.
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: ULYSSES
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: Nor mine, my lord: Cressid was here but now.
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: TROILUS
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Let it not be believed for womanhood!
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Think, we had mothers; do not give advantage
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: To stubborn critics, apt, without a theme,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: For depravation, to square the general sex
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: By Cressid's rule: rather think this not Cressid.
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: ULYSSES
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: What hath she done, prince, that can soil our mothers?
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: TROILUS
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Nothing at all, unless that this were she.
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: THERSITES
lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.value: Will he swagger himself out on's own eyes?
lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.value: TROILUS
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: This she? no, this is Diomed's Cressida:
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: If beauty have a soul, this is not she;
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: If souls guide vows, if vows be sanctimonies,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: If sanctimony be the gods' delight,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: If there be rule in unity itself,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: This is not she. O madness of discourse,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: That cause sets up with and against itself!
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Bi-fold authority! where reason can revolt
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Without perdition, and loss assume all reason
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Without revolt: this is, and is not, Cressid.
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Within my soul there doth conduce a fight
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Of this strange nature that a thing inseparate
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Divides more wider than the sky and earth,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: And yet the spacious breadth of this division
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Admits no orifex for a point as subtle
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: As Ariachne's broken woof to enter.
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Instance, O instance! strong as Pluto's gates;
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Cressid is mine, tied with the bonds of heaven:
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Instance, O instance! strong as heaven itself;
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: The bonds of heaven are slipp'd, dissolved, and loosed;
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: And with another knot, five-finger-tied,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: The fractions of her faith, orts of her love,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: The fragments, scraps, the bits and greasy relics
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Of her o'er-eaten faith, are bound to Diomed.
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: ULYSSES
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: May worthy Troilus be half attach'd
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: With that which here his passion doth express?
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: TROILUS
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Ay, Greek; and that shall be divulged well
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: In characters as red as Mars his heart
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Inflamed with Venus: never did young man fancy
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: With so eternal and so fix'd a soul.
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Hark, Greek: as much as I do Cressid love,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: So much by weight hate I her Diomed:
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: That sleeve is mine that he'll bear on his helm;
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Were it a casque composed by Vulcan's skill,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: My sword should bite it: not the dreadful spout
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Which shipmen do the hurricano call,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Constringed in mass by the almighty sun,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Shall dizzy with more clamour Neptune's ear
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: In his descent than shall my prompted sword
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Falling on Diomed.
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: THERSITES
lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.value: He'll tickle it for his concupy.
lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.value: TROILUS
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: O Cressid! O false Cressid! false, false, false!
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Let all untruths stand by thy stained name,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: And they'll seem glorious.
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: ULYSSES
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: O, contain yourself
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: Your passion draws ears hither.
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: AENEAS
lines.speaker: AENEAS

lines.value: I have been seeking you this hour, my lord:
lines.speaker: AENEAS

lines.value: Hector, by this, is arming him in Troy;
lines.speaker: AENEAS

lines.value: Ajax, your guard, stays to conduct you home.
lines.speaker: AENEAS

lines.value: TROILUS
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Have with you, prince. My courteous lord, adieu.
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Farewell, revolted fair! and, Diomed,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Stand fast, and wear a castle on thy head!
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: ULYSSES
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: I'll bring you to the gates.
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: TROILUS
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Accept distracted thanks.
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: THERSITES
lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.value: Would I could meet that rogue Diomed! I would
lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.value: croak like a raven; I would bode, I would bode.
lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.value: Patroclus will give me any thing for the
lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.value: intelligence of this whore: the parrot will not
lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.value: do more for an almond than he for a commodious drab.
lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.value: Lechery, lechery; still, wars and lechery; nothing
lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.value: else holds fashion: a burning devil take them!
lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.value: ANDROMACHE
lines.speaker: ANDROMACHE

lines.value: When was my lord so much ungently temper'd,
lines.speaker: ANDROMACHE

lines.value: To stop his ears against admonishment?
lines.speaker: ANDROMACHE

lines.value: Unarm, unarm, and do not fight to-day.
lines.speaker: ANDROMACHE

lines.value: HECTOR
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: You train me to offend you; get you in:
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: By all the everlasting gods, I'll go!
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: ANDROMACHE
lines.speaker: ANDROMACHE

lines.value: My dreams will, sure, prove ominous to the day.
lines.speaker: ANDROMACHE

lines.value: HECTOR
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: No more, I say.
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: CASSANDRA
lines.speaker: CASSANDRA

lines.value: Where is my brother Hector?
lines.speaker: CASSANDRA

lines.value: ANDROMACHE
lines.speaker: ANDROMACHE

lines.value: Here, sister; arm'd, and bloody in intent.
lines.speaker: ANDROMACHE

lines.value: Consort with me in loud and dear petition,
lines.speaker: ANDROMACHE

lines.value: Pursue we him on knees; for I have dream'd
lines.speaker: ANDROMACHE

lines.value: Of bloody turbulence, and this whole night
lines.speaker: ANDROMACHE

lines.value: Hath nothing been but shapes and forms of slaughter.
lines.speaker: ANDROMACHE

lines.value: CASSANDRA
lines.speaker: CASSANDRA

lines.value: O, 'tis true.
lines.speaker: CASSANDRA

lines.value: HECTOR
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: Ho! bid my trumpet sound!
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: CASSANDRA
lines.speaker: CASSANDRA

lines.value: No notes of sally, for the heavens, sweet brother.
lines.speaker: CASSANDRA

lines.value: HECTOR
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: Be gone, I say: the gods have heard me swear.
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: CASSANDRA
lines.speaker: CASSANDRA

lines.value: The gods are deaf to hot and peevish vows:
lines.speaker: CASSANDRA

lines.value: They are polluted offerings, more abhorr'd
lines.speaker: CASSANDRA

lines.value: Than spotted livers in the sacrifice.
lines.speaker: CASSANDRA

lines.value: ANDROMACHE
lines.speaker: ANDROMACHE

lines.value: O, be persuaded! do not count it holy
lines.speaker: ANDROMACHE

lines.value: To hurt by being just: it is as lawful,
lines.speaker: ANDROMACHE

lines.value: For we would give much, to use violent thefts,
lines.speaker: ANDROMACHE

lines.value: And rob in the behalf of charity.
lines.speaker: ANDROMACHE

lines.value: CASSANDRA
lines.speaker: CASSANDRA

lines.value: It is the purpose that makes strong the vow;
lines.speaker: CASSANDRA

lines.value: But vows to every purpose must not hold:
lines.speaker: CASSANDRA

lines.value: Unarm, sweet Hector.
lines.speaker: CASSANDRA

lines.value: HECTOR
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: Hold you still, I say;
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: Mine honour keeps the weather of my fate:
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: Lie every man holds dear; but the brave man
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: Holds honour far more precious-dear than life.
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: How now, young man! mean'st thou to fight to-day?
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: ANDROMACHE
lines.speaker: ANDROMACHE

lines.value: Cassandra, call my father to persuade.
lines.speaker: ANDROMACHE

lines.value: HECTOR
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: No, faith, young Troilus; doff thy harness, youth;
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: I am to-day i' the vein of chivalry:
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: Let grow thy sinews till their knots be strong,
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: And tempt not yet the brushes of the war.
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: Unarm thee, go, and doubt thou not, brave boy,
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: I'll stand to-day for thee and me and Troy.
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: TROILUS
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Brother, you have a vice of mercy in you,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Which better fits a lion than a man.
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: HECTOR
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: What vice is that, good Troilus? chide me for it.
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: TROILUS
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: When many times the captive Grecian falls,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Even in the fan and wind of your fair sword,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: You bid them rise, and live.
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: HECTOR
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: O,'tis fair play.
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: TROILUS
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Fool's play, by heaven, Hector.
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: HECTOR
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: How now! how now!
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: TROILUS
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: For the love of all the gods,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Let's leave the hermit pity with our mothers,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: And when we have our armours buckled on,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: The venom'd vengeance ride upon our swords,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Spur them to ruthful work, rein them from ruth.
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: HECTOR
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: Fie, savage, fie!
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: TROILUS
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Hector, then 'tis wars.
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: HECTOR
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: Troilus, I would not have you fight to-day.
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: TROILUS
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Who should withhold me?
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Not fate, obedience, nor the hand of Mars
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Beckoning with fiery truncheon my retire;
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Not Priamus and Hecuba on knees,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Their eyes o'ergalled with recourse of tears;
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Not you, my brother, with your true sword drawn,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Opposed to  hinder me, should stop my way,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: But by my ruin.
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: CASSANDRA
lines.speaker: CASSANDRA

lines.value: Lay hold upon him, Priam, hold him fast:
lines.speaker: CASSANDRA

lines.value: He is thy crutch; now if thou lose thy stay,
lines.speaker: CASSANDRA

lines.value: Thou on him leaning, and all Troy on thee,
lines.speaker: CASSANDRA

lines.value: Fall all together.
lines.speaker: CASSANDRA

lines.value: PRIAM
lines.speaker: PRIAM

lines.value: Come, Hector, come, go back:
lines.speaker: PRIAM

lines.value: Thy wife hath dream'd; thy mother hath had visions;
lines.speaker: PRIAM

lines.value: Cassandra doth foresee; and I myself
lines.speaker: PRIAM

lines.value: Am like a prophet suddenly enrapt
lines.speaker: PRIAM

lines.value: To tell thee that this day is ominous:
lines.speaker: PRIAM

lines.value: Therefore, come back.
lines.speaker: PRIAM

lines.value: HECTOR
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: AEneas is a-field;
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: And I do stand engaged to many Greeks,
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: Even in the faith of valour, to appear
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: This morning to them.
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: PRIAM
lines.speaker: PRIAM

lines.value: Ay, but thou shalt not go.
lines.speaker: PRIAM

lines.value: HECTOR
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: I must not break my faith.
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: You know me dutiful; therefore, dear sir,
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: Let me not shame respect; but give me leave
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: To take that course by your consent and voice,
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: Which you do here forbid me, royal Priam.
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: CASSANDRA
lines.speaker: CASSANDRA

lines.value: O Priam, yield not to him!
lines.speaker: CASSANDRA

lines.value: ANDROMACHE
lines.speaker: ANDROMACHE

lines.value: Do not, dear father.
lines.speaker: ANDROMACHE

lines.value: HECTOR
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: Andromache, I am offended with you:
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: Upon the love you bear me, get you in.
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: TROILUS
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: This foolish, dreaming, superstitious girl
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Makes all these bodements.
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: CASSANDRA
lines.speaker: CASSANDRA

lines.value: O, farewell, dear Hector!
lines.speaker: CASSANDRA

lines.value: Look, how thou diest! look, how thy eye turns pale!
lines.speaker: CASSANDRA

lines.value: Look, how thy wounds do bleed at many vents!
lines.speaker: CASSANDRA

lines.value: Hark, how Troy roars! how Hecuba cries out!
lines.speaker: CASSANDRA

lines.value: How poor Andromache shrills her dolours forth!
lines.speaker: CASSANDRA

lines.value: Behold, distraction, frenzy and amazement,
lines.speaker: CASSANDRA

lines.value: Like witless antics, one another meet,
lines.speaker: CASSANDRA

lines.value: And all cry, Hector! Hector's dead! O Hector!
lines.speaker: CASSANDRA

lines.value: TROILUS
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Away! away!
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: CASSANDRA
lines.speaker: CASSANDRA

lines.value: Farewell: yet, soft! Hector! take my leave:
lines.speaker: CASSANDRA

lines.value: Thou dost thyself and all our Troy deceive.
lines.speaker: CASSANDRA

lines.value: HECTOR
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: You are amazed, my liege, at her exclaim:
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: Go in and cheer the town: we'll forth and fight,
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: Do deeds worth praise and tell you them at night.
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: PRIAM
lines.speaker: PRIAM

lines.value: Farewell: the gods with safety stand about thee!
lines.speaker: PRIAM

lines.value: TROILUS
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: They are at it, hark! Proud Diomed, believe,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: I come to lose my arm, or win my sleeve.
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: PANDARUS
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: Do you hear, my lord? do you hear?
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: TROILUS
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: What now?
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: PANDARUS
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: Here's a letter come from yond poor girl.
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: TROILUS
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Let me read.
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: PANDARUS
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: A whoreson tisick, a whoreson rascally tisick so
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: troubles me, and the foolish fortune of this girl;
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: and what one thing, what another, that I shall
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: leave you one o' these days: and I have a rheum
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: in mine eyes too, and such an ache in my bones
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: that, unless a man were cursed, I cannot tell what
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: to think on't. What says she there?
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: TROILUS
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Words, words, mere words, no matter from the heart:
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: The effect doth operate another way.
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Go, wind, to wind, there turn and change together.
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: My love with words and errors still she feeds;
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: But edifies another with her deeds.
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: THERSITES
lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.value: Now they are clapper-clawing one another; I'll go
lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.value: look on. That dissembling abominable varlets Diomed,
lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.value: has got that same scurvy doting foolish young knave's
lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.value: sleeve of Troy there in his helm: I would fain see
lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.value: them meet; that that same young Trojan ass, that
lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.value: loves the whore there, might send that Greekish
lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.value: whore-masterly villain, with the sleeve, back to the
lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.value: dissembling luxurious drab, of a sleeveless errand.
lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.value: O' the t'other side, the policy of those crafty
lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.value: swearing rascals, that stale old mouse-eaten dry
lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.value: cheese, Nestor, and that same dog-fox, Ulysses, is
lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.value: not proved worthy a blackberry: they set me up, in
lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.value: policy, that mongrel cur, Ajax, against that dog of
lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.value: as bad a kind, Achilles: and now is the cur Ajax
lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.value: prouder than the cur Achilles, and will not arm
lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.value: to-day; whereupon the Grecians begin to proclaim
lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.value: barbarism, and policy grows into an ill opinion.
lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.value: Soft! here comes sleeve, and t'other.
lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.value: TROILUS
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Fly not; for shouldst thou take the river Styx,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: I would swim after.
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: DIOMEDES
lines.speaker: DIOMEDES

lines.value: Thou dost miscall retire:
lines.speaker: DIOMEDES

lines.value: I do not fly, but advantageous care
lines.speaker: DIOMEDES

lines.value: Withdrew me from the odds of multitude:
lines.speaker: DIOMEDES

lines.value: Have at thee!
lines.speaker: DIOMEDES

lines.value: THERSITES
lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.value: Hold thy whore, Grecian!--now for thy whore,
lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.value: Trojan!--now the sleeve, now the sleeve!
lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.value: HECTOR
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: What art thou, Greek? art thou for Hector's match?
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: Art thou of blood and honour?
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: THERSITES
lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.value: No, no, I am a rascal; a scurvy railing knave:
lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.value: a very filthy rogue.
lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.value: HECTOR
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: I do believe thee: live.
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: THERSITES
lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.value: God-a-mercy, that thou wilt believe me; but a
lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.value: plague break thy neck for frightening me! What's
lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.value: become of the wenching rogues? I think they have
lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.value: swallowed one another: I would laugh at that
lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.value: miracle: yet, in a sort, lechery eats itself.
lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.value: I'll seek them.
lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.value: DIOMEDES
lines.speaker: DIOMEDES

lines.value: Go, go, my servant, take thou Troilus' horse;
lines.speaker: DIOMEDES

lines.value: Present the fair steed to my lady Cressid:
lines.speaker: DIOMEDES

lines.value: Fellow, commend my service to her beauty;
lines.speaker: DIOMEDES

lines.value: Tell her I have chastised the amorous Trojan,
lines.speaker: DIOMEDES

lines.value: And am her knight by proof.
lines.speaker: DIOMEDES

lines.value: Servant
lines.speaker: Servant

lines.value: I go, my lord.
lines.speaker: Servant

lines.value: AGAMEMNON
lines.speaker: AGAMEMNON

lines.value: Renew, renew! The fierce Polydamas
lines.speaker: AGAMEMNON

lines.value: Hath beat down Menon: bastard Margarelon
lines.speaker: AGAMEMNON

lines.value: Hath Doreus prisoner,
lines.speaker: AGAMEMNON

lines.value: And stands colossus-wise, waving his beam,
lines.speaker: AGAMEMNON

lines.value: Upon the pashed corses of the kings
lines.speaker: AGAMEMNON

lines.value: Epistrophus and Cedius: Polyxenes is slain,
lines.speaker: AGAMEMNON

lines.value: Amphimachus and Thoas deadly hurt,
lines.speaker: AGAMEMNON

lines.value: Patroclus ta'en or slain, and Palamedes
lines.speaker: AGAMEMNON

lines.value: Sore hurt and bruised: the dreadful Sagittary
lines.speaker: AGAMEMNON

lines.value: Appals our numbers: haste we, Diomed,
lines.speaker: AGAMEMNON

lines.value: To reinforcement, or we perish all.
lines.speaker: AGAMEMNON

lines.value: NESTOR
lines.speaker: NESTOR

lines.value: Go, bear Patroclus' body to Achilles;
lines.speaker: NESTOR

lines.value: And bid the snail-paced Ajax arm for shame.
lines.speaker: NESTOR

lines.value: There is a thousand Hectors in the field:
lines.speaker: NESTOR

lines.value: Now here he fights on Galathe his horse,
lines.speaker: NESTOR

lines.value: And there lacks work; anon he's there afoot,
lines.speaker: NESTOR

lines.value: And there they fly or die, like scaled sculls
lines.speaker: NESTOR

lines.value: Before the belching whale; then is he yonder,
lines.speaker: NESTOR

lines.value: And there the strawy Greeks, ripe for his edge,
lines.speaker: NESTOR

lines.value: Fall down before him, like the mower's swath:
lines.speaker: NESTOR

lines.value: Here, there, and every where, he leaves and takes,
lines.speaker: NESTOR

lines.value: Dexterity so obeying appetite
lines.speaker: NESTOR

lines.value: That what he will he does, and does so much
lines.speaker: NESTOR

lines.value: That proof is call'd impossibility.
lines.speaker: NESTOR

lines.value: ULYSSES
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: O, courage, courage, princes! great Achilles
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: Is arming, weeping, cursing, vowing vengeance:
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: Patroclus' wounds have roused his drowsy blood,
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: Together with his mangled Myrmidons,
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: That noseless, handless, hack'd and chipp'd, come to him,
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: Crying on Hector. Ajax hath lost a friend
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: And foams at mouth, and he is arm'd and at it,
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: Roaring for Troilus, who hath done to-day
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: Mad and fantastic execution,
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: Engaging and redeeming of himself
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: With such a careless force and forceless care
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: As if that luck, in very spite of cunning,
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: Bade him win all.
lines.speaker: ULYSSES

lines.value: AJAX
lines.speaker: AJAX

lines.value: Troilus! thou coward Troilus!
lines.speaker: AJAX

lines.value: DIOMEDES
lines.speaker: DIOMEDES

lines.value: Ay, there, there.
lines.speaker: DIOMEDES

lines.value: NESTOR
lines.speaker: NESTOR

lines.value: So, so, we draw together.
lines.speaker: NESTOR

lines.value: ACHILLES
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: Where is this Hector?
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: Come, come, thou boy-queller, show thy face;
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: Know what it is to meet Achilles angry:
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: Hector? where's Hector? I will none but Hector.
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: AJAX
lines.speaker: AJAX

lines.value: Troilus, thou coward Troilus, show thy head!
lines.speaker: AJAX

lines.value: DIOMEDES
lines.speaker: DIOMEDES

lines.value: Troilus, I say! where's Troilus?
lines.speaker: DIOMEDES

lines.value: AJAX
lines.speaker: AJAX

lines.value: What wouldst thou?
lines.speaker: AJAX

lines.value: DIOMEDES
lines.speaker: DIOMEDES

lines.value: I would correct him.
lines.speaker: DIOMEDES

lines.value: AJAX
lines.speaker: AJAX

lines.value: Were I the general, thou shouldst have my office
lines.speaker: AJAX

lines.value: Ere that correction. Troilus, I say! what, Troilus!
lines.speaker: AJAX

lines.value: TROILUS
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: O traitor Diomed! turn thy false face, thou traitor,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: And pay thy life thou owest me for my horse!
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: DIOMEDES
lines.speaker: DIOMEDES

lines.value: Ha, art thou there?
lines.speaker: DIOMEDES

lines.value: AJAX
lines.speaker: AJAX

lines.value: I'll fight with him alone: stand, Diomed.
lines.speaker: AJAX

lines.value: DIOMEDES
lines.speaker: DIOMEDES

lines.value: He is my prize; I will not look upon.
lines.speaker: DIOMEDES

lines.value: TROILUS
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Come, both you cogging Greeks; have at you both!
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: HECTOR
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: Yea, Troilus? O, well fought, my youngest brother!
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: ACHILLES
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: Now do I see thee, ha! have at thee, Hector!
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: HECTOR
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: Pause, if thou wilt.
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: ACHILLES
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: I do disdain thy courtesy, proud Trojan:
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: Be happy that my arms are out of use:
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: My rest and negligence befriends thee now,
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: But thou anon shalt hear of me again;
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: Till when, go seek thy fortune.
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: HECTOR
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: Fare thee well:
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: I would have been much more a fresher man,
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: Had I expected thee. How now, my brother!
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: TROILUS
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Ajax hath ta'en AEneas: shall it be?
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: No, by the flame of yonder glorious heaven,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: He shall not carry him: I'll be ta'en too,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Or bring him off: fate, hear me what I say!
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: I reck not though I end my life to-day.
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: HECTOR
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: Stand, stand, thou Greek; thou art a goodly mark:
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: No? wilt thou not? I like thy armour well;
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: I'll frush it and unlock the rivets all,
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: But I'll be master of it: wilt thou not,
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: beast, abide?
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: Why, then fly on, I'll hunt thee for thy hide.
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: ACHILLES
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: Come here about me, you my Myrmidons;
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: Mark what I say. Attend me where I wheel:
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: Strike not a stroke, but keep yourselves in breath:
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: And when I have the bloody Hector found,
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: Empale him with your weapons round about;
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: In fellest manner execute your aims.
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: Follow me, sirs, and my proceedings eye:
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: It is decreed Hector the great must die.
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: THERSITES
lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.value: The cuckold and the cuckold-maker are at it. Now,
lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.value: bull! now, dog! 'Loo, Paris, 'loo! now my double-
lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.value: henned sparrow! 'loo, Paris, 'loo! The bull has the
lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.value: game: ware horns, ho!
lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.value: MARGARELON
lines.speaker: MARGARELON

lines.value: Turn, slave, and fight.
lines.speaker: MARGARELON

lines.value: THERSITES
lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.value: What art thou?
lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.value: MARGARELON
lines.speaker: MARGARELON

lines.value: A bastard son of Priam's.
lines.speaker: MARGARELON

lines.value: THERSITES
lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.value: I am a bastard too; I love bastards: I am a bastard
lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.value: begot, bastard instructed, bastard in mind, bastard
lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.value: in valour, in every thing illegitimate. One bear will
lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.value: not bite another, and wherefore should one bastard?
lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.value: Take heed, the quarrel's most ominous to us: if the
lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.value: son of a whore fight for a whore, he tempts judgment:
lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.value: farewell, bastard.
lines.speaker: THERSITES

lines.value: MARGARELON
lines.speaker: MARGARELON

lines.value: The devil take thee, coward!
lines.speaker: MARGARELON

lines.value: HECTOR
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: Most putrefied core, so fair without,
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: Thy goodly armour thus hath cost thy life.
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: Now is my day's work done; I'll take good breath:
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: Rest, sword; thou hast thy fill of blood and death.
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: ACHILLES
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: Look, Hector, how the sun begins to set;
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: How ugly night comes breathing at his heels:
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: Even with the vail and darking of the sun,
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: To close the day up, Hector's life is done.
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: HECTOR
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: I am unarm'd; forego this vantage, Greek.
lines.speaker: HECTOR

lines.value: ACHILLES
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: Strike, fellows, strike; this is the man I seek.
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: So, Ilion, fall thou next! now, Troy, sink down!
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: Here lies thy heart, thy sinews, and thy bone.
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: On, Myrmidons, and cry you all amain,
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: 'Achilles hath the mighty Hector slain.'
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: Hark! a retire upon our Grecian part.
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: MYRMIDONS
lines.speaker: MYRMIDONS

lines.value: The Trojan trumpets sound the like, my lord.
lines.speaker: MYRMIDONS

lines.value: ACHILLES
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: The dragon wing of night o'erspreads the earth,
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: And, stickler-like, the armies separates.
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: My half-supp'd sword, that frankly would have fed,
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: Pleased with this dainty bait, thus goes to bed.
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: Come, tie his body to my horse's tail;
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: Along the field I will the Trojan trail.
lines.speaker: ACHILLES

lines.value: AGAMEMNON
lines.speaker: AGAMEMNON

lines.value: Hark! hark! what shout is that?
lines.speaker: AGAMEMNON

lines.value: NESTOR
lines.speaker: NESTOR

lines.value: Peace, drums!
lines.speaker: NESTOR

lines.value: Achilles! Achilles! Hector's slain! Achilles.
lines.speaker: NESTOR

lines.value: DIOMEDES
lines.speaker: DIOMEDES

lines.value: The bruit is, Hector's slain, and by Achilles.
lines.speaker: DIOMEDES

lines.value: AJAX
lines.speaker: AJAX

lines.value: If it be so, yet bragless let it be;
lines.speaker: AJAX

lines.value: Great Hector was a man as good as he.
lines.speaker: AJAX

lines.value: AGAMEMNON
lines.speaker: AGAMEMNON

lines.value: March patiently along: let one be sent
lines.speaker: AGAMEMNON

lines.value: To pray Achilles see us at our tent.
lines.speaker: AGAMEMNON

lines.value: If in his death the gods have us befriended,
lines.speaker: AGAMEMNON

lines.value: Great Troy is ours, and our sharp wars are ended.
lines.speaker: AGAMEMNON

lines.value: AENEAS
lines.speaker: AENEAS

lines.value: Stand, ho! yet are we masters of the field:
lines.speaker: AENEAS

lines.value: Never go home; here starve we out the night.
lines.speaker: AENEAS

lines.value: TROILUS
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Hector is slain.
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: ALL
lines.speaker: ALL

lines.value: Hector! the gods forbid!
lines.speaker: ALL

lines.value: TROILUS
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: He's dead; and at the murderer's horse's tail,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: In beastly sort, dragg'd through the shameful field.
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Frown on, you heavens, effect your rage with speed!
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Sit, gods, upon your thrones, and smile at Troy!
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: I say, at once let your brief plagues be mercy,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: And linger not our sure destructions on!
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: AENEAS
lines.speaker: AENEAS

lines.value: My lord, you do discomfort all the host!
lines.speaker: AENEAS

lines.value: TROILUS
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: You understand me not that tell me so:
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: I do not speak of flight, of fear, of death,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: But dare all imminence that gods and men
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Address their dangers in. Hector is gone:
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Who shall tell Priam so, or Hecuba?
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Let him that will a screech-owl aye be call'd,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Go in to Troy, and say there, Hector's dead:
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: There is a word will Priam turn to stone;
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Make wells and Niobes of the maids and wives,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Cold statues of the youth, and, in a word,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Scare Troy out of itself. But, march away:
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Hector is dead; there is no more to say.
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Stay yet. You vile abominable tents,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Thus proudly pight upon our Phrygian plains,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Let Titan rise as early as he dare,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: I'll through and through you! and, thou great-sized coward,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: No space of earth shall sunder our two hates:
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: I'll haunt thee like a wicked conscience still,
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: That mouldeth goblins swift as frenzy's thoughts.
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Strike a free march to Troy! with comfort go:
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Hope of revenge shall hide our inward woe.
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: PANDARUS
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: But hear you, hear you!
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: TROILUS
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Hence, broker-lackey! ignomy and shame
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: Pursue thy life, and live aye with thy name!
lines.speaker: TROILUS

lines.value: PANDARUS
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: A goodly medicine for my aching bones! O world!
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: world! world! thus is the poor agent despised!
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: O traitors and bawds, how earnestly are you set
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: a-work, and how ill requited! why should our
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: endeavour be so loved and the performance so loathed?
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: what verse for it? what instance for it? Let me see:
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: Full merrily the humble-bee doth sing,
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: Till he hath lost his honey and his sting;
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: And being once subdued in armed tail,
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: Sweet honey and sweet notes together fail.
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: Good traders in the flesh, set this in your
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: painted cloths.
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: As many as be here of pander's hall,
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: Your eyes, half out, weep out at Pandar's fall;
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: Or if you cannot weep, yet give some groans,
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: Though not for me, yet for your aching bones.
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: Brethren and sisters of the hold-door trade,
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: Some two months hence my will shall here be made:
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: It should be now, but that my fear is this,
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: Some galled goose of Winchester would hiss:
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: Till then I'll sweat and seek about for eases,
lines.speaker: PANDARUS

lines.value: And at that time bequeathe you my diseases.
lines.speaker: PANDARUS
